title: Slow Chicken Soup
description: Takes forever, but worth the time
time: Roughly 1 hour prep. Roughly 5 hours to cook.
ingredients:
For Broth:
1 Whole Frying Chicken
2 Long Carrots - Whole Chunks
1 Medium Onion - Whole Chunks
2 Ribs of Celery - Whole Chunks
6 Green Onions - Whole Chunks
1 Head Of Garlic - Halved
1 1in Knob of Ginger - Large Slices
3 6in Pieces of Kombu
1 ¼ cup of Soy Sauce
3 qts of water

For Soup:
3 Medium Onions
6 Long Carrots
6 Ribs of Celery
4 tbsp of Jamieson Chicken Bouillon
steps:
Roasting Chicken
Separate chicken from skeletal structure.
Reserve chicken.
Place skeletal structure and dermal structure on cookie sheet lined with foil.
Add carrots, onions, celery.
Roast at 400 F for 60 minutes.
Remove from oven.
Preparing The Broth
Place roasted contents in pot.
Add the rest of the broth ingredients.
Simmer for 3 hours
Preparing The Soup
Strain the broth through a fine mesh sieve.
Add chicken and rest of soup ingredients.
Simmer for 30-40 minutes.
Remove, cool, and shred chicken.
Put chicken back in pot and serve.
notes: Was initially used as half of a double soup broth in Ramen. We generally found that the roasting makes this soup a looooot tastier.
